metadata.title: CVE-2017-13728 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible
metadata.description:
There is an infinite loop in the next_char function in comp_scan.c inncurses 6.0, related to libtic. A crafted input will lead to a remotedenial of service attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13728` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32ncursesw6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32tinfo6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64ncurses6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64ncursesw6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64tinfo6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncurses6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncursesw6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libtinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libtinfo6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-base - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-bin - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-examples - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-term - 6.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ncurses package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1-1ubuntu1').
